You have begun preparations for the Tawusgerran, the Circulation of the Peacock. You send out messengers with invitations to your vassals, expecting all to come and honor [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
Come all to celebrate His Wisdom!

Dear vassal,
I hereby invite you to attend the celebration of the Tawusgerran at [From.Capital.GetName].

Your Liege,
[From.GetTitledName]
I look forward to it!
Your vassal, [From.GetTitledName], has refused your invitation to the Tawusgerran.
Well, I don't like him either

Guests have arrived from villages throughout the realm, to celebrate the Tawusgerran, The Circulation of the Peacock.  Priests walk throughout the crowds, giving out vials of Holy Water to the faithful.
Let's get this party started!
The Tawusgerran is over for this time. [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] has been properly honored and the realm is looking forward to a bright future under His wisdom.
Until next time!
The Circulation of the Peacock

The Circulation of the Peacock is about to start, and in accordance with tradition, priests and pious men carry the senjaq, statues of the Seven Archangles in circles around the city, distributing blessings in the name of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].  To be allowed to carry one of the statues is a honor reserved for only those of great wisdom and piety, as well as an event requiring strength and willpower.
Today I shall carry a burden for the glory of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
I always enjoy watching the Circulation. From a well shaded location.

As you carry the heavy senjaq around, you discover that it is rather more heavier that you expected. The unaccustomed weight causes you to stumble, and the idol slips out of your hands and crashes down on top of you.
Surely that's not a bad omen

As you carry the heavy senjaq around, the weight and the heat begin to take their toll on you. As if in a dream, you begin to hear the voices of the Seven Archangels talking, telling you secrets and mysteries.
The wisdom the Seven is revealed to me!
With each step of the Circulation, more and more of the truth of your religion is reveled to you. Of course this is the proper path, how could any man doubt such a truth?
For the glory of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
What once seemed so heavy at the start now feels as light as feather. Why, you could carry this senjaq around all day if the priests would let you!
Strength comes from [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
Veneration of the Senjaq

After the Senjaq have been paraded around the city, the populace comes forward to present their sacrifices and venerations. You visit each senjaq in turn, praying for the wisdom of the Seven Archangels, venerating them with holy incense.
For Wisdom and Honor.
Collection of Gifts from the Pious

The final stage of the Festival is the collection of alms and taxes from the pious. Every pious man is expected to give, to aid those destitute and in need. While most give only a few coins, truly pious are expected to provide much more.\n\n As the priests wind their way towards you through the crowd, you reach for your purse. How much in alms should you give today?
As much as I can spare, for the people need it more.
The bare minimum I can get away with.
Give handouts? Bah, those peasants need to get a job!

The final ceremony is a grand sermon of thanksgiving to God and his servants. It was a rousing sermon as always, and the crowd begins the feast with great abandon. Another glorious celebration of the Seven Archangels has completed!
Praise [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
The Koasasa

Although many have doubted in the past, there no longer room for any doubt. The signs have spoken, and have been proven by actions. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] is a koasasa, an incarnation of one of the Holy Seven Archangels in the flesh, that has descended to Earth to give aid and succor to his people. Let there be proclamations of joy and thanksgiving, and may God strike down any man that doubts his divine providence!
Let there be feasts in celebration!
My piety and wisdom has been rewarded! I have been recognized as the koasasa of Melek Taus, the Peacock Angel!
I knew there was something special about me
My piety and wisdom has been rewarded! I have been recognized as the koasasa of Melek Israfel, the Burning Angel of the Trumpet!
My piety and wisdom has been rewarded! I have been recognized as the koasasa of Melek Azrael, the Angel of Death!
My piety and wisdom has been rewarded! I have been recognized as the koasasa of Melek Mihael, the Commander of the Armies of God!
My piety and wisdom has been rewarded! I have been recognized as the koasasa of Melek Dardael!
My piety and wisdom has been rewarded! I have been recognized as the koasasa of Melek Samael, the Accuser and Destroyer!
My piety and wisdom has been rewarded! I have been recognized as the koasasa of Melek Nurael

The Yazidis venerate seven archangels that the one creator God, entrusted the world to. Of this Heptad of seven Holy Beings, known as the the Seven Mysteries, any Yazidi can chose one in particular to favor
Melek Taus, the Peacock Angel!
Melek Israfel, the Burning Angel of the Trumpet!
Melek Azrael, the Angel of Death!
There are other angels to consider to consider
Melek Mihael, the Commander of the Armies of God!
Melek Dardael, the Silent One!
Melek Samael, the Accuser and Destroyer!
Melek Nurael, the Healer!
Observe the Circulation of the Peacock
Holding a Peacock Feast
Attending a Peacock Feast
Your latest collection of poems has made quite the stir at court, and your courtiers can't stop talking about them. Your fame as a poet has spread
And father said I should have been an doctor
A brilliant mood has you in its grip! You have a grand idea for an epic poem, that once complete shall ensure your fame for all eternity
Yes, yes! I just need a word that rhymes with nightingale...
Your epic poem is lacking a certain something, and you need some inspiration.  What do you need to stimulate your creative juices?
Women!
Wine!
Song!
Screw that, give me all three!
To firmly set your epic poem in the correct zeitgeist, you need to study the proper environment to set the scene.  Where should you start your investigation?
Observe the fashions of the nobility for a courtly scene
Talk with the men of the army for a military setting
Study in the Library for a historical setting
You have found a beautiful woman to serve as your Beatrice for your epic poem. But you are sad to learn she is already married! Your heart is breaking
Drown your sorrows at the nearest House of Ill Repute
Make your poem about unrequited love
Writer's Block. You spend all day staring at an empty parchment, unable to get anywhere with your epic poem.
Shake things up with a party
Lock yourself in a minaret until you write something
Despair! Trying to write this epic poem has left you in despair!
I'll never finish this!
I have to concentrate harder
You've realized you haven't written anything on your epic poem in almost a year.
I'll get right on it! Tomorrow!
You've had a great breakthrough on your epic poem, and the words flow from your pen like...things flowing from a something that flows...
Dammit, lost it again
Finally, after much work and toil, you've finally completed your epic poem. The beauty of it is sublime, the imagery innovative and story is inspiring.  You can't wait to recite it before the court.
It's... beautiful...
The recital was perfect. Your voice held the crowd in rapturous delight, and not even half fell asleep during it. A great success
Now, to find out what they thought of it

Your courtiers repeatedly praised your poem and flattered your skills as a poet, but later you happened to overhear several of them, thinking they were out of earshot, lambasting your poem as a terrible, juvenile and dreadful
Everyone is a critic
Your fame as a poet has spread far and wide, and several Sultans and Emirs have written, asking for copies of your work
I am so awesome

Working in these dimly lit rooms, studying the secrets hidden in the letters of the Holy Qur'an, through countless sleepless nights has taken a toll on your eyes.  You fear your sight is starting to go
Nonsense, I can see...um, why is it so dark in here?
While the secrets hidden within the code remain elusive, all this constant studying has improved your overall knowledge
A little knowledge can go a long way
Spending so much time cooped up in a small room, studying the secrets hidden in the holy books, has take a toll on your body.  Your muscles have atrophied and your reactions are slowed
Maybe I should get out a bit more
While the true secrets hidden in the holy book has eluded you, working at solving these puzzles has sharped your mind to a fine edge
Soon the knowledge will be mine
You have mastered the hidden secrets in the Persian and Arabic alphabets as well as the knowledge of numerology. You now know many mystic secrets
Soon the world will be mine
Weeks, months, spent studying the Holy Qur'an to grasp its secrets, and yet you feel further away from the truth then when you started.  Could this all be just a waste of time?
Why doesn't any of this make sense?
Women, their beauty has only served to distract you from your true calling unlocking the secrets of the Holy Qur'an In fact, you think it would be best to ignore them all together
No girls allowed
As you slowly start to unlock the secrets of the Holy Qur'an, your new found knowledge has improved your ability to seek the pattern in events around you
I'm beginning to connect the dots
The knowledge you've gained through studying mystic secrets has improved your skills and education
There is a lot left to be learned
It all makes the sense now! The secrets hidden by Allah in the Qur'an, they are now all self-evident to you. The knowledge of the past and future has been revealed
I am the greatest!
All those late nights, spent pouring over the Holy Qur'an, has take its toll on your health.  You think you've started to catch a cold
Maybe I should cut back a little
You've used your knowledge of the secrets hidden in code in the Holy Qur'an to predict the future, yet all your predictions have turned out wrong, and your subjects are getting restless
Where did I go wrong?
Your knowledge of the secrets hidden in code in the Holy Qur'an have predicted a strong and prosperous future for you and your nation
Rejoice, peasants
Your knowledge of the secrets hidden in code in the Holy Qur'an have predicted a dark and troubled time for you and your nation.  The news has upset the commonfolk
Allah will see us through this trouble
Your knowledge of the secrets hidden in code in the Holy Qur'an have brought great fame and renown to yourself
Allah be praised

Hurufi Initiate
This man has begun to pierce the veil of hidden knowledge
Hurufi Adept
This man has discovered the hidden knowledge written in the Qur'an

Studying Hidden Secrets
Being locking away studying secrets does not endear one to his vassals
Writing Epic Poem

Epic Poet
This man has written a poem of great scope and measure
Wrong Omen
This man's attempts at reading the future have been proven wrong
Good Omen
Fantastic events have been predicted
Bad Omen
Horrible events have been predicted

Even after the Tsar converted to Christianity, many of the common people remained pagan, the problem exasperated by the priests the Greek Emperor sent to convert the populace. Few enjoyed sermons they did not understand preached in a language they did not speak. To better bring the Light of Christ, a Bulgarian born monk began preaching the Gospel in the native tongue, his sermons touching on the communion of property, clerical poverity, and an end to feudal servitude, all dangerous and considered heretical. His form of Christianity has spread like wildfire throughout the Kingdom of Bulgaria.
Invite the man to court
Ignore the madman
Have him 'silenced'

While some of the ideas of this Bogomil are quite... unorthodox, he does present an interesting opportunity. By converting to his brand of Christianity, you could establish your own state church with him as your Patriarch, with no reliance on the Greeks in Constantinople. Of course, this would invite reprisals
Make Bogomil the Patriarch of a new Church
I can not afford a conflict with the Greeks right now
He his a very funny man indeed! Make him wear bells!

the Diwan

The time has come. The end of days are upon us, and the corrupt rulers of Dar al-Islam spend their time bickering and fighting each other. But there is still hope. While on the Hajj, the voices began to speak to you, telling you secrets formerly unrevealed. You are the Mahdi, the prophesied final redeemer!
I will proclaim myself before the scholars!
Despite your proclamation, you have been completely ignored by the other pilgrims in Mecca. No one seems to believe you are truly the Mahdi
Those poor unbelievers, I will pray for their souls
Maybe I am not really the Mahdi...

Upon returning home, the voices start again. You again proclaim yourself the Mahdi, in front of court, but this time is different. Your subjects, knowing your piety, believe your claims, and begin to prepare for the endtimes
I am the Prophesied Redeemer!

A man, descended from the Prophet, living a perfect and blameless life, has proclaimed himself the Mahdi, the Prophesied Redeemer of Islam and the harbinger of the endtimes.  Whether he is touched by madness or divinely inspired, his preaching has spread his followers throughout the hinderlands of Dar al-Islam. Condemned by the heterodox ulema, a storm is brewing through the lands.
The Proclamation of the Madhi
Allah will bring them light
Praise to the Mahdi!
Bah, this is nothing but foolish nonsense
The endtimes are upon us. The world screams for the Redeemer, and the responsibility falls to you. Proclaim yourself the Mahdi, and bring peace to this troubled world
Inshallah

The power of the millenarian heretic sect of the Zikri have expanded to the point where they are able to proclaim their own Caliph, whom they claim is the Prophesied Mahdi. Although not acknowledged as such by other Muslims, he nevertheless commands a might horde of fanatics as they await the end of the world
Zikri Caliphate
Glory to us
Praise to the Caliph
Bah, this is nothing but foolish nonsense
The Mahdi
This man claims to be the Madhi, the Prophesied Redeemer of Islam
The Mahdi
Zikri Caliphate
Caliphal
Create the Zikri Caliphate
Declare yourself the Caliph and Mahdi of the Zikri
Choghan
This character has performed a Zikri ziyarat
To commemorate the teachings of the Mahdi, on the twenty seventh day of Ramadan, the pious Zikri men preform a ziyarat, a pilgrimage, scaling a nearby mountain in ceremony called Choghan
Climb the mountain
Watch the ceremony from the valley below

Scaling this cliff has been quite the challenge, and your arms and legs are burning from the exertion. But despite this, you find the experience fulfilling. Perhaps you should take up mountain climbing as a hobby?
Sounds like a good idea

The physical exertion of the climb has caused many to fall back, but you scale the heights as effortlessly as a mountain goat. By the time the rest of the procession arrives at the gathering point, you are already there to greet them.
First!
Night falls as you continue to climb, and far from the city the heavens are ablaze with starlight. You stop and pause for a bit, marveling at the handywork of God
My God, it's full of stars
As you scale the mountainside, a misjudged step causes you to stumble and fall. You catch yourself before you tumble all the way down, but sprain your ankle in the process
Ouch!

Climbing up this stupid rock is a lot harder than it looks. If it was for some loyal retainers, you'd never reach the gathering point. Still, you'll need to have a talk with them. Hoisting a lord over their shoulders like a sack of barley is just not dignified
Put me down already

Climbing is hard work, especially on an empty stomach. As you scramble up the path, you spot some red wild berries growing on a stunted bush. The sun is just above the horizon, so it would be sin, yet... so hungry!
It's the white berries that are poisonous, right?
They were planted by [Root.Religion.GetEvilRandomGodName] to tempt me!

Hiking is thirsty work, and your waterskin has run dry before the sun had set. A fellow compatriot passes you his, and you take a large gulp of the contents. To your surprise, the liquid inside is not water, but a raw kind of alcohol, that leaves your mouth burning and you coughing and sputtering
Hey, this is good stuff
As you navigate up the heights, your foot slips on a patch of loose gravel, and you lose your balance. Hands reach out to grab you, but not soon enough, as you tumble down the mountain to your death
That was embarrassing

Recent heavy rains have made the mountain side unstable. As you slog through the mud, you hear an ominous sound above you. You turn, and to your growing horror see the land above churning and tumbling towards you. It's a landslide!
Run forward and try to beat the slide
Dive behind a large boulder
Run down the mountain away from the slide
You collapse, panting and heaving, legs feeling like jelly. Behind you, the rumblings of the earth slow and cease. Somehow, you've made it out alive
Thank [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]

You can not escape as the the very surface of the earth rebels and flows like water. The landslide reaches you and throws you down the mountain side. Miraculously, you survive, if somewhat worse for the wear
Ouch!
Although the boulder groans ominously as the landslide passes around it, it remains firm, holding you in a small pocket of safety until the roaring stops
Praise be to [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]
Not even the weightt of this boulder can stop this landslide. With a sour groan, it crashes down the mountain, burying your broken body in the mud
Just like that old Gypsy woman said!
A bitter cold encases you as you climb higher. By the time you reach the gathering point, two fingers and the tips of your ears have turned black from frostbite
I should have dressed warmer
Upon reaching the gathering place high on the mountain, you and your coreligionists celebrate and pray in remembrance of the revelations of the Mahdi
May peace be upon him
Your actions have proven you worthy of deeper initiation into the secret rites of the Druze. It is considered a great honor to join this elite group of religious leaders
I am willing to take the oaths
On second thought, I prefer ignorance
Oath of al-'Ahd

I, [From.GetTitledFirstName], being sane of spirit and body and duly qualified, attest on my soul, without compulsion or constraint, that I renounce all the different cults, religions, and creeds and acknowledge nothing other than obedience to our Lord al-Hakim, revered be his name, and obedience is worship; that in his worship I associate no past, present, or future being; that I commit my soul, my body, my property, and my offspring to our Lord al-Hakim the guide of those who respond to the divine call and the avenger on the polytheists with the sword of our Lord.
So I swear
Mithaq Walley El-Zaman

I rely on our Moula Al-Hakim the lonely God, the individual, the eternal, who is out of couples and numbers, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has approved recognition enjoined on himself and on his soul, in a healthy of his mind and his body, permissibility aversive is obedient and not forced, to repudiate from all creeds, articles and all religions and beliefs on the differences varieties, and he does not know something except obedience of almighty Moulana Al-Hakim, and obedience is worship and that it does not engage in worship anyone ever attended or wait, and that he had handed his soul and his body and his money and all he owns to almighty Maulana Al-Hakim
I solemnly swear

Only the greatest and most brilliant of the Uqqal become the Ajawid, the highest religious authorities of the religion. Other Ajawid in the realm have sat in judgment of your abilities, and have found you qualified to join them in discovering the Truth hidden within the Hidden
I take such a burden gravely
Ascent to Ajawid
A Druze, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has ascended to the rank of Ajawid, becoming one of the leaders of the religion
Good to hear

Each color of the Druze star symbolizes a metaphysical power called haad, literally 'a limit', which represents the boundaries that separate humans from animals. Each adult Druze can choose a haad to focus on
The color Green stands for 'aql, the Universal Mind
Red represents Nafs, the Universal Soul
Yellow symbolizes Kalima, the Word
There are other haad to consider
Blue stands for Sabiq, Potentiality, Cause, and Precedent
The color White represents Tali, the Future and Effects
Druze Esoteric Learning
This character has been studying the Druze religious secrets
Interesting...

After bloody battles and massacres, the remnants of the Druze have been driven into Southern Lebanon and Syria. With the support of sympathetic local rulers, the Druze have found a new home where they hope they can live forever in peace
The Melancholy of Hamza ibn 'Ali
In that part of the world?
Sheikh
Sheikha

My little [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has an odd birthmark that closely matches that of my [GetFromReincarnationRelation], [From.Reincarnation.GetBestName]. Could [From.Reincarnation.GetSubjectPronoun] have been reborn as my [GetFromRelation] in this life?
All things are possible by [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]
No, that is just superstition
Sometimes I think of my other family, when I was an old [Root.Reincarnation.GetManWoman]. Where are all my old friends?
I miss them...

My beloved [GetFromRelation] is showing every sign of being my reborn [GetFromReincarnationRelation] [From.Reincarnation.GetFirstName]. Little [From.GetFirstName] often speaks of [From.GetObjectPronoun] old friends and family, even naming many correctly.
I wonder how alike [From.Reincarnation.GetFirstName] [From.GetSubjectPronoun] will become...
Remarkable, but I want [From.GetObjectPronoun] raised as a new person.
My tutors say that they see more of my [GetReincarnationRelation] [Root.Reincarnation.GetFirstName] in me every day, even though my own vague memories of that past life are fading fast.
I just feel like... me.
My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName], [From.Reincarnation.GetTitledFirstName] reborn, is acting more like [From.GetPossPronoun] previous incarnation every day!
This is a gift from [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]

[Root.Reincarnation.Killer.GetFirstName]!' you scream as you wake up from a horrible nightmare of being killed. As your guards come rushing in, you calm down and realize that it was no ordinary dream. You remember the name of the one who had you murdered in your previous life as [Root.Reincarnation.GetBestName] - the evil [Root.Reincarnation.Killer.GetBestName]!
That vicious spawn of a blind camel!

As you gaze idly into the pond, a feeling of deep love suddenly comes over you, and then, the sweetest memory. You remember making love to your beloved [Root.GetHusbandWife] [Root.Reincarnation.Spouse.GetFirstName] by another pool of water, in another forest, in another life...
Ah, [Root.Reincarnation.Spouse.GetFirstName] my love, where are you now?

Watching a group of children at play, you suddenly remember another child, little [Root.Reincarnation.GetFirstName], who was your precious firstborn when you were in the world as [Root.Reincarnation.GetBestName].
They ways of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] are mysterious
[This.GetTitledFirstName] wants to learn Hidden Truths
Study the Esoteric Secrets

Druze believe in Theophany, which they call Tajalli, in which the ineffable nature of God is made manifest in a human being. By your traits and piety, you have been declared as a Tajalli by your peers. It is a great honor
I am touched, really

Although you were once considered as the force of God incarnate, it turns out you are only human after all. You failure to live up to the high standards of the Tajalli have cause you to be shunned in the community
Most unfair!
Run for it!
Dangers await...
Your liege receives a letter...
[Root.GetTitledName] made a pious pilgrimage to Lalish
I shall go on a pilgrimage to attend the Feast of the Assembly at Lalish
I will start making travel plans.
My things are packed, everything is in order. Soon, I shall travel to Lalish and the tomb Sheikh Adi
My journey begins!
The rain has been pouring down for days, it's almost impossible to travel the roads. Why does [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] punish his faithful servants so?
Blessed is [Root.GetSheHe] who perseveres under trial.
This is absurd - I should have stayed home!

You look out across the beautiful valley stretching out before you. It would be a wonderful moment, if not for the fact that there should be no valley here. You are a stranger in an stranger land and you have no idea where you are.
If only I hadn't listened to those useless peasants that gave me directions.
If only I'd listened more to those peasants that gave me directions.
Deep in the night...

Sleeping at the pilgrim's inn, you dream a beautiful dream. You are walking through a dense wood, filled with the wonderful sounds and smells of nature. Little squirrels run across your path and birds sing in the trees. You keep walking through the wood, and then you notice a new and strange but familiar smell. You can't quite put your finger on what it is, though. Hmm, it's something you should know, something important... Hmm... yes, it's... it's... it's fire! You are instantly wide awake. The room is hot, you can hear the sound of crackling flames and a moment later you also hear people screaming. Indeed, the inn is on fire!
Help put it out!
Save yourself and let others handle it.

They said this was a lawless stretch of road, but you still feel rather unlucky to be in this situation. The robbers are many and armed, and they demand that you pay a 'toll' before you are allowed to pass.
Pay up.
Give these scoundrels the only thing they deserve – steel!
The old wooden bridge has carried many pilgrims in its day. It creaks suspiciously as you step on it.
No time to stop, I'm sure it'll hold.
Stop and help repair it.
These people deserve a stone bridge. I shall pay for it.

You lay awake at night reflecting on your pilgrimage. It's an inner journey as well as a physical one, but can you be sure of which destination it will take you to? And do you even want to have that certainty?
The mind wanders where it will.
It's all right there on the map. Time to get some sleep!

The journey is long and hard. Your feet are sore, and your back as well. Far from the castle kitchens the food is barely edible, and on top of that you seem to feel cold all the time. Perhaps you were not quite cut out for traveling?
My faith will see me through.
Maybe this was a bad idea. I'll stay and rest for a while.

The stories of other pilgrims all spoke of how impressive this place is. Now that you can see it with your own eyes, you can only join in their praise. You are glad that you made the trip to Lalish and the tomb of Sheikh Adi
It was well worth the journey!

As you walk around on this holy ground, you ponder the secrets and the essence of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]. The teachings of the holy church have never felt more relevant to you than now. Imagine the knowledge contained in the scriptures stored here!
The way to Heaven is through study.
No, I shall spend my time praying.

The tombs, this holy ground, how it all moves my soul! I realize now that all my life up to this point has only been a preparation for this journey. How wondrous that the light of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] truly shines in me, a poor sinner. From now on I shall always do His work.
Praise [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!

Traveling all this way to see the holy places, you had hoped for more than this. It's just lots of people, some tombs and a few bones that really look quite suspicious. Before coming, you had read the exalted stories of other pilgrims, but this just isn't like they described it.
That's it?

As you approach the holy shrine, you overhear a theological discussion between several priests. You stop and eagerly engage them in conversation, expanding upon several of your favorite topics.
